Feed.Id: determines Id of a feed, should be Integer only
Feed.ProviderId: determines provider of data,should be Integer only,use 62
Feed.Name: determines name of a feed based on Data Context and ProviderName
Feed.Description: determines description of a feed based on data context
Feed.ImportFrequencyId: should be determined based on customer's preferences; 1 - Daily,2 - Monthly, 3 - Yearly, 4 - Hourly, 5 - Weekly, 6 - Quarterly

FileDefinitions.FileTypeId: If file type is CSV/text then 1, If file type is xml then 2, If file type is json then 3, If file type is excel then 4,sohuld be Integer
FileDefinitions.Name: set to null by default
FileDefinitions.FileNameRegex: here you should use RegEx pattern syntax to validate a name of a file
FileDefinitions.FileNameRegexDescription: describe FileNameRegex pattern that was built previously
FileDefinitions.CsvDelimiterCharacter: here you should identify a delimiter character of a CSV file
FileDefinitions.TrimWhiteSpaces: removes leading and trailing white spaces. Usually set to true
FileDefinitions.ColumnHeaderTypeSeparator: here you should identify a column header separator of a CSV file
FileDefinitions.ReadHeaders: true by default, if no headers presented in a file then false
FileDefinitions.CheckHeaders: true by default,if all headers from the file are presented
FileDefinitions.SkipFirstNumberOfLines: should determine number of lines which are not related to headers and headers' data; if first lines are empty and there is no data, skip them and put the number of lines you skipped
FileDefinitions.EndOfFileRegex: determine the end of Regex file, based on regex syntax
FileDefinitions.NumberDecimalSeparator: here you should determine a separator of decimal values; could be dot or comma, still based on CSV file
FileDefinitions.XmlNamespaces: should be constructed as alias=namespace, example: d="<namespace>"
FileDefinitions.RootJsonPath: do not set root path here, set it under NodeXPath below, set to null by default
FileDefinitions.SheetNumber: only used for excel data type. fill  in as number of tab you currently take a data from,otherwise null

TableDefinitions.TableName: name of a table to import data to; can be generated based on data context as general name
TableDefinitions.NodeXPath: generate it for xml data types,otherwise null. Fill in the root path to a parent first-level node(xpath) for which a table should be created, null by default for other file types
TableDefinitions.NodeJsonPath: generate it for json data types,otherwise null. Fill in the root path to a parent first level node for which a table should be created, null by default for other file types

ColumnDefinitions.HeaderName: here you should fill in a name of a column header which is presented within a [biqh_import_field]
ColumnDefinitions.SampleData: fill in single value example of corresponding column
ColumnDefinitions.Name: here you should fill in a name of a column header which is presented within a [customer_field]
ColumnDefinitions.DataTypeId: here you should determine a data type based on determination of it previously within [biqh_column_data_type]; Please map it according to the list: 1-nvarchar,2-Int;3-decimal;4-date;5-datetime;6-time;7-boolean;8-bigint;9-binary;10-any;
ColumnDefinitions.Length: you should use it for data type 1 or 10 and determine a length of string column you already determined previously,otherwise null
ColumnDefinitions.Precision: you should use it for data type 3 and determine a precision part of decimal column you already determined previously,otherwise null
ColumnDefinitions.Format: The expected data format used only  for date and time columns, specified in a standard format string
ColumnDefinitions.Description: description of a column header based on financial knowledge you have
ColumnDefinitions.Scale: you should use it for data type 3 and determine a scale part of decimal column you already determined previously,otherwise null
ColumnDefinitions.AllowLeadingWhite: always set to false by default
ColumnDefinitions.AllowTrailingWhite: always set to false by default
ColumnDefinitions.AllowLeadingSign: you should use it for data type 3 and determine if a decimal value contains leading sign (if yes - true) otherwise set to false by default
ColumnDefinitions.AllowTrailingSign: you should use it for data type 3 and determine if a decimal value contains trailing sign (if yes - true) otherwise set to false by default
ColumnDefinitions.AllowParentheses: you should use it for data type 3 and determine if a decimal value contains parentheses (if yes - true) otherwise false
ColumnDefinitions.AllowDecimalPoint: you should use it for data type 3 and determine if a decimal value contains decimal point after main decimal separator (if yes - true) otherwise false;
ColumnDefinitions.AllowExponent: you should use it for data type 3 and determine if a decimal value contains Exponent sign (if yes - true) otherwise false;
ColumnDefinitions.AllowCurrencySymbol: you should use it for data type 3 and determine if a decimal value contains Currency symbol sign (if yes - true) otherwise false;
ColumnDefinitions.AllowPercentage: you should use it for data type 3 and determine if a decimal value contains percentage symbol sign (if yes - true) otherwise false;
ColumnDefinitions.CultureInfo: If specified, indicates the cultural or regional formatting rules that apply to the data, affecting aspects like date formats or numeric separators,otherwise null
ColumnDefinitions.ColumnTypeId: If file type is xml use '5'; if file type is json use '6' else 1-Column Number(Is used when CSV/Excel/Text files do not contain headers, 'ColumnNumber' attribute should contain a correct sequence number in order to correctly read columns of a file; 2-Column Header (is used when CSV/Excel/Text files contain headers); 3- Composite field
ColumnDefinitions.ColumnNumber: required field;fill in based on sequential number of a column in a file (starts from 0)
ColumnDefinitions.XPath: generate for xml data types,otherwise null.Fill in  xpath to a second level node from which value should be extracted to the corresponding column taking into account NodeXpath root filled in previously, null by default for other data types
ColumnDefinitions.JsonPath: generate for json data types,otherwise null.Fill in  path to a second level node from which value should be extracted to the corresponding column taking into account NodeJsonpath root filled in previously, null by default for other data types
ColumnDefinitions.SourceName: Fill in the column's header from the file

Validations.ValidationTypeId: you should fill in validation per column you added: If column from the analysis file is always filled then put 1 - NotEmpty; if column from the analysis file is determined as Isin then put 3 - IsIsin;if column from the analysis file is determined as Currency and length of it = 3  then put 4 - IsCurrency,if column from the analysis file is determined as nvarchar data type then put 10 - MaxLength, otherwise null
Validations.Parameter: you should fill in parameters like: for  string column - length of nvarchar determined by analysis file

Validations.ValidationTypeId: Optional validations, could be more than one per column, define based on description provided for ValidationTypeId previously
Validations.Parameter: you should fill in parameters like: for  string column - length of nvarchar determined by analysis file

BiqhTableMaps.BiqhTableName: name of [biqh_parent_table_name] table and [biqh_relation_table_name] table that SQL query is used for to merge data. PER TABLE!
BiqhTableMaps.SqlQuery:
SQL query to map data based on mapping file: where [biqh_import_field] is mapped per BIQH column in [biqh_parent_column_name] per  table from [biqh_parent_table_name] and [biqh_relation_table_name]; --Starting from 
	 SELECT DISTINCT r.[customer_field] AS [biqh_parent_column_name], ... 
	 FROM
	@Schema.[table name from FileDefinition] ae  --could have joins IF [biqh_relation_table_name] is filled 
	  
 --ending with default filtering like ->  WHERE
	ae.Record_ImportId = @ImportId
	AND ae.Record_HasError = 0
